file.title: AMM PART II-1285 - CHAPTER 53-31-09-04 - BAGGAGE DOOR PROTECTOR STRIP - REMOVAL/INSTALLATION

page.data: AIRCRAFT MAINTENANCE MANUAL BAGGAGE DOOR PROTECTOR STRIP - REMOVAL/INSTALLATION EFFECTIVITY: ALL 1. General A. This section gives the procedures to remove and install the protector strip of the baggage door. B. The procedures in this section are given in the sequence below. The tasks identified with ( ♦) are part of the Scheduled Maintenance Requirements Document (SMRD). TASK NUMBER DESCRIPTION EFFECTIVITY BAGGAGE DOOR PROTECTOR STRIP - ALL 53-31-09-000-801-A REMOVAL BAGGAGE DOOR PROTECTOR STRIP - ALL 53-31-09-400-801-A INSTALLATION EMB-145 - AMM 1285 General 53-31-09 Page 1 of 6 Rev 48 - Oct 30/15 Copyright ÃÂ© by Embraer S.A. All rights reserved - See title page for details.

AIRCRAFT MAINTENANCE MANUAL TASK 53-31-09-000-801-A EFFECTIVITY: ALL 2. BAGGAGE DOOR PROTECTOR STRIP - REMOVAL A. General (1) This procedure gives the instructions to remove the protector strip of the baggage door. B. References REFERENCE DESIGNATION AMM SDS 52-30-00/1 AIRCRAFT SAFE PROCEDURES FOR MAINTE- AMM TASK 20-00-00-910-801-A/200 NANCE SERVICES - MAINTENANCE PRACTICES C. Zones and Accesses Not Applicable D. Tools and Equipment Not Applicable E. Auxiliary Items ITEM DESCRIPTION PURPOSE QTY Commercially Gloves AR available Commercially Goggles AR available Commercially Mask AR available Commercially Wiper cloth AR available F. Consumable Materials SPECIFICATION DESCRIPTION QTY (BRAND) TT-M-261 Methyl Ethyl Ketone (MEK) AR G. Expandable Parts Not Applicable H. Persons Recommended QTY FUNCTION PLACE 1 Does the task Baggage compartment - LH EMB-145 - AMM 1285 000-801-A/400 53-31-09 Page 2 of 6 Rev 48 - Oct 30/15 Copyright ÃÂ© by Embraer S.A. All rights reserved - See title page for details.

AIRCRAFT MAINTENANCE MANUAL I. Preparation SUBTASK 841-002-A (1) Put the aircraft on safe condition for maintenance ( AMM TASK 20-00-00-910-801-A/ 200). (2) Open the baggage door (AMM SDS 52-30-00/1). J. Removal (Figure 401) SUBTASK 020-002-A (1) Remove the screws (5). (2) Remove the nut-screws (4). (3) Remove the profile protections (1), (2) and (3), and the washers (6). WARNING: USE SEALANTS OR SOLVENTS IN AREAS WITH A GOOD AIRFLOW. DO NOT GET THESE PRODUCTS ON YOUR SKIN FOR A LONG TIME AND DO NOT BREATHE THEIR VAPORS. IF YOU DO, INJURIES CAN OCCUR TO YOU. PUT ON PROTECTION MASK, GLOVES AND SAFETY GOGGLES. (4) Clean the aircraft structure and components with a cloth soaked in MEK. EMB-145 - AMM 1285 000-801-A/400 53-31-09 Page 3 of 6 Rev 48 - Oct 30/15 Copyright ÃÂ© by Embraer S.A. All rights reserved - See title page for details.

PROFILE PROTECTION 4. NUT-SCREW 2. PROFILE PROTECTION 2 3 C 5. SCREW 1 6. WASHER TYPICAL 1 SEALANT P/S870B-2 DET. C 2 ADHESIVE LOCTITE 221 3 TORQUE: 0.8 - 1.0 N.M (7.0 - 9.0 LB.IN) EM145AMM530451A.DGN EMB-145 - AMM 1285 000-801-A/400 53-31-09 Page 4 of 6 Rev 48 - Oct 30/15 Copyright ÃÂ© by Embraer S.A. AIRCRAFT MAINTENANCE MANUAL TASK 53-31-09-400-801-A EFFECTIVITY: ALL 3. BAGGAGE DOOR PROTECTOR STRIP - INSTALLATION A. General (1) This procedure gives the instructions to install the protector strip of the baggage door. B. References REFERENCE DESIGNATION AMM SDS 52-30-00/1 SRM 51-20-01 - C. Zones and Accesses Not Applicable D. Tools and Equipment ITEM DESCRIPTION PURPOSE QTY Commercially Torque wrench: 0 - 1.7 N.m (0 - 15 lb.in) 1 available E. Auxiliary Items ITEM DESCRIPTION PURPOSE QTY Commercially Gloves AR available Commercially Goggles AR available Commercially Mask AR available F. Consumable Materials SPECIFICATION DESCRIPTION QTY (BRAND) MEP 09-005 Adhesive, Loctite 221 AR MIL-S-81733 Type IV, Class 12 Sealant, Polysulfide - P/S870B-2 AR G. Expandable Parts Not Applicable H. Persons Recommended QTY FUNCTION PLACE 1 Does the task Baggage compartment - LH EMB-145 - AMM 1285 400-801-A/400 53-31-09 Page 5 of 6 Rev 48 - Oct 30/15 Copyright ÃÂ© by Embraer S.A. All rights reserved - See title page for details.

AIRCRAFT MAINTENANCE MANUAL I. Installation (Figure 401) SUBTASK 420-002-A WARNING: USE SEALANTS OR SOLVENTS IN AREAS WITH A GOOD AIRFLOW. DO NOT GET THESE PRODUCTS ON YOUR SKIN FOR A LONG TIME AND DO NOT BREATHE THEIR VAPORS. IF YOU DO, INJURIES CAN OCCUR TO YOU. PUT ON PROTECTION MASK, GLOVES AND SAFETY GOGGLES. (1) Do a faying surface sealing with sealant P/S870B-2 at the aircraft structure on the profile protections place, refer to (SRM 51-20-01). (2) Put the washers (6) in position on the aircraft structure. (3) Put the profile protections (1), (2) and (3) in position on the aircraft structure. NOTE: The holes of the aircraft structure and profile protections must be aligned with the washers (6). (4) Wet install the nut-screws (4) with sealant P/S870B-2. (5) Wet install the screws (5) with adhesive Loctite 221. With a torque wrench, apply a tightening torque of 0.8 - 1.0 N.m (7.0 - 9.0 lb.in). J. Follow-on SUBTASK 841-003-A (1) Close the baggage door (AMM SDS 52-30-00/1). (2) Put the aircraft back on its initial configuration.
